channel.title: So wait, is Dumbledore really truly gay?
channel.description:
http://www.newsweek.com/id/50787
J.K. Rowling, author of the world-wide best-selling Harry Potter series, met some of her American fans Friday night and provided some surprising revelations about the fictional characters who a generation of children have come to regard as close friends. In front of a full house of hardcore Potter fans at Carnegie Hall in New York, Rowling, sitting on the stage on a red velvet and carved wood throne, read from her seventh and final book, "Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows," then took questions. [b]One fan asked whether Albus Dumbledore, the head of the famed Hogwarts School of Wizardry and Witchcraft, had ever loved anyone. Rowling smiled. "Dumbledore is gay, actually," replied Rowling as the audience errupted in surprise. She added that, in her mind, Dumbledore had an unrequited love affair with Gellert Grindelwald, Voldemort's predecessor who appears in the seventh book. After several minutes of prolonged shouting and clapping from astonshed fans, Rowling added. "I would have told you earlier if I knew it would make you so happy." [/b] In answer to the question "Did Hagrid marry?" Rowling replied that sadly, no. The half-giant had a flirtation with a giantess but she found him "a tad unsophisticated" and the relationship never went forward. In response to the audience's groans of dismay, Rowling said, jokingly, "O.K., I'll write another book." And when the audience continued to express disapproval added, "at least I didn't kill him." Other minor characters, according to Rowling, came to happier ends. Neville Longbottom, Harry's meek and hapless classmate, married Hannah Abbott, another classmate.

item.title: So wait, is Dumbledore really truly gay?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

PaulT:

That honestly sounds as if she made it up on the spot just to be awesome. Whatever. We all know Dumbledore’s secret desire. Socks.

Looks like you read the whole series … not.

Dumbledore said “I see myself with a new pair of socks” but he just said that to lie to harry because he actually saw himself with his sister (who he may have killed).

I can’t believe Dumbledore is gay! I hope they do something funny in the next movie where he comes onto harry. LMFAO!

Read full topic

Remember the secret meetings that he had with Harry in the 6th book
[/quote]
